title: I have a weird question about my family

I've asked him if he's okay and if there's something wrong with him, but he just laughs and says "It's nothing you need to worry about". He also started changing his behavior in ways that are weird and not consistent with him. He used to be very calm and collected, but now he's always agitated and on edge. He's also been spending a lot of time doing research online, especially about topics related to competition and strategy.   He also started being more involved in our lives than usual, and it feels really strange. He's been trying to set up dates for us as a family, which is unsettling because we never do that. He also seems to be trying to influence our decisions, and he's been pushing us to pursue things that aren't aligned with our interests. It's all so confusing and creepy, and I'm starting to wonder if he's involved in something dangerous.  The thing is, when I ask him what's going on, he always deflects by telling me it's nothing I need to worry about. So I'm left wondering if he knows what's going on and is deliberately keeping it from me, or if he's genuinely not aware of how his actions are affecting us.   Does anyone else have any insights or advice?  Thank you in advance.

title: The most expensive thing I've ever bought was a used car
self_text: I paid $4,000 for it back in 2018 and it only had 75,000 miles on it.  It was a beautiful red Mustang GT with black leather seats and a powerful engine.  I loved that car so much and drove it every day for years.  Iâ€™d take it to the beach and drive it around town.  But then my dad got sick and needed some money for medical bills, so I sold it for $13,000.   It still makes me sad when I think about it.  I really miss that car.  I wish I hadn't sold it.  I wish I could have kept it forever.  I just donâ€™t know why I did what I did.  I probably didnâ€™t want to spend all of my money on myself because I wanted to be able to help my family.   It was stupid at the time but now looking back it was probably the right decision. I just felt like a selfish person at the time.  I never told anyone how much that car meant to me.  I was afraid they would judge me or tell me that I should have kept it.   But it was my favorite possession.  I was so happy when I had it.  Now I don't even remember what it sounded like.   When I put it up for sale I was too ashamed to admit that I loved it.   So I lied about its condition and told people that it was in good shape.   I knew that was wrong.   I shouldnâ€™t have done that.   I should have been honest with them.   I am not sure if I will ever get another car again.   My old man told me he wasnâ€™t gonna give me any money for the repairs on the car and I was so angry and upset.  He said that he could buy me a new car but I didn't want him to do that because I didnâ€™t want to be indebted to him.   I felt like he was trying to control me.   I thought he was being mean and disrespectful.   I didnâ€™t want to be his daughter anymore.   I wanted to run away from home and live on my own.   I thought that I would be free if I left my parents behind.   But I realized that I couldn't survive without their support.   They always took care of me.   They gave me everything I needed.   They were there for me through thick and thin.   I canâ€™t imagine my life without them.   I love them so much.   And I hate myself for letting them down.   I need to make things right. title: The only thing I can do is to be a good person and live a peaceful life.
self_text: So, I'm not sure how else I could have come to the conclusion that there isn't anything more I can do other than just being a good person and living a peaceful life.  I've tried to help others and improve my environment but it seems like nothing ever works out as expected.  So, if you see me doing something seemingly random or going in an unexpected direction, please understand why I am doing so.  It doesn't mean that I'm trying to be a bad person or do things for personal gain.  I'm just trying to find what's important to me and live my life accordingly.

title: Should I be worried about the fact that my mother is getting married again?
self_text: My mom has been seeing a guy for almost two years now, and they're planning to get married in six months. Heâ€™s an older guy, like, mid-fifties, and sheâ€™s 40.  She seems genuinely happy and loves him, but I have concerns. Iâ€™m concerned because heâ€™s not very nice, he does not take care of himself or his property, heâ€™s constantly drinking, and heâ€™s got some issues with anger management. Should I be worried? How do I approach this conversation without being judgmental? Or should I just accept it and move on?

title: I want to know if anyone else feels like they're being gaslighted by their family for being a bad cook?
self_text: They keep saying my cooking is terrible, and that i should just eat out more. But then every time I try to cook something they say "I'll make it" but never do. When I asked them to teach me how to cook, they said "oh no you can't because we don't have enough ingredients". Like why did you buy the ingredients in the first place? It seems like they are purposely trying to discourage me from cooking.   Is this normal or am I just being paranoid?  Any advice would be appreciated.

title: I had a weird dream last night...

title: What are some good ways to get into the best universities?
self_text: I'm a high school junior and have been working really hard in school to try and get into top tier universities like Harvard, Yale, Columbia, etc.   I've gotten mostly A's and B's (with a couple of C's) but I'm still pretty proud of my grades.  But how can I make myself stand out from other applicants who also have great grades?   I am really interested in computer science and engineering, so I would love to major in that field.

I was just watching a show about a dog and it made me think of my childhood and how happy I used to be, so I wanted to share with you all how I felt when I was young.
self_text: When I was young, the world was a playground full of possibilities. I would run around with my friends, building castles in the sand and making up stories as we went along. I loved exploring new places, discovering hidden trails and marveling at the beauty of nature. There were no worries or anxieties back then, just pure joy and excitement for life. But now that I'm older, things have changed. The world can be a difficult place sometimes, filled with challenges and setbacks. It's easy to get caught up in the negativity and lose sight of what truly matters. However, I want to remember those days and keep them alive by taking action today. So hereâ€™s what I do. 1) I try to stay positive, even when things are tough. 2) I make time for activities that bring me joy, like reading, hiking, or spending time with loved ones. 3) I practice gratitude, appreciating everything I have in my life. And most importantly, I never stop learning and growing. I know there will always be obstacles in my path, but Iâ€™m determined to overcome them and live a fulfilling life.  I hope you guys had an amazing day! Don't forget to eat your vegetables! ğŸ˜‚

title: I love the way that we can turn off the TV and have a discussion on our favorite movies/shows.  I also like how my parents keep saying â€œyou donâ€™t have to eat your vegetablesâ€ but then they will leave me some in the fridge for me to eat later, which is nice.  I think itâ€™s really cool that my mom has a job where she can work from home.   I know I could do that too if I was older. I would probably go out and get myself a good laptop and a big desk so I can be more productive. I also love how my dad takes his dog everywhere he goes. It's cute when he does that.  I feel bad for people who donâ€™t have dogs because I think they are amazing animals.  I hope I can own a dog someday, maybe a golden retriever or a labrador. They seem very friendly and smart. I am hoping I can get into a college soon so I can start working toward having a career that I enjoy.  My dad says I should pick something that pays well and also something that I am passionate about.  That is kind of hard to find, but I think I can do it.  I just need to be patient and work hard at it.  I am excited to see what the future holds for me. I hope I will have lots of friends and family around me to support me. And I hope I will travel the world and experience different cultures.  I want to visit Europe and Asia.  Maybe Japan or South Korea.  I also want to visit Canada.  And Australia.  It sounds like it would be an amazing place to live.   What do you guys think?
